title: The Chaoswar Saga
text:
The Chaoswar Saga is the final <a href="trilogy">trilogy</a> in the <a href="The%20Riftwar%20Cycle">Riftwar Cycle</a> <a href="book%20series">series</a> of <a href="fantasy">fantasy</a> novels by <a href="Raymond%20E.%20Feist">Raymond E. Feist</a>.
Concept.
In the fantasy novels of Feist, a Riftwar is war between two worlds that are connected by some sort of dimensionless gap (rift). In Feist's invented history there are several riftwars. The first Riftwar between <a href="Midkemia">Midkemia</a> and <a href="Kelewan">Kelewan</a> is described in the trilogy "<a href="The%20Riftwar%20Saga">The Riftwar Saga</a>". Feist has confirmed that there are five Riftwars in total.
This Saga is the conclusion of Feist's preceding <a href="The%20Riftwar%20Cycle">Riftwar Cycle</a> works and is the fifth, and final, Riftwar.
Works in the series.
"A Crown Imperilled" (2012).
The book was released in the United Kingdom on 30 January 2012 and in Australia on 1 February 2012.
It was released in the United States on 15 March 2012.
First editions in all three countries have a continuity error in the later parts of the book. Pug, a pivotal character in all of Feist's Riftwar novels, appears in two places at once due to an editing error.
